reasoning: Diabetic neuropathy is a major complication of diabetes with estimated incidence ~4-5 per 100k person-years based on cohort studies and diabetes registry data. Represents new cases of clinically significant neuropathy in the general population annually.
source: Vinik AI et al. (2003). Diabetic neuropathies. Lancet. 362(9388):1275-1286; Complemented by IDF Diabetes complications epidemiology
